title: "Terror Has No Religion, But...": Accused In Malegaon Blast Case Acquitted
content: Nearly 17 years after a powerful bomb tore through Maharashtra's Malegaon, killing six people and injuring more than a hundred, a special court in Mumbai today acquitted all seven accused in the case.

title: US Tariffs India Live Updates: As Trump's Tariff Deadline Approaches, List Of Trade Deals US Signed
content: US Tariffs On India LIVE Updates: Hours after announcing 25 per cent tariffs on Indian imports, US President Donald Trump has hit out at New Delhi and its trading partner Moscow.

title: "Who Killed The 6 People": Asaduddin Owaisi On Malegaon Blast Case Verdict
content: Shortly after a special court acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, including former BJP MP Pragya Thakur, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi asked a question: "Who killed the six people?"

title: "US Acting Unreasonable, India Should Not Give In": Shashi Tharoor On Tariffs
content: US President Donald Trump's decision to impose a 25% additional import duty plus penalty on goods imported from India is "completely unreasonable" even as negotiations for a trade agreement are underway, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said on Thursday.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Tariffs: Diplomacy Is Dead, But Long Live Social Media Bluster
content: Trump's playbook is vintage. He first extends his hand as a friend, then strikes with the force of a bully. His tariffs are not about the principle of fairness. They are a blunt instrument wielded for selfish reasons, for dominance and spectacle.

title: Trump Tariff Deadline Looms Large: Trade Deals US Has Announced So Far
content: The clock is ticking closer to the US President's latest tariff deadline of August 1. And while several more deals or frameworks for deals have been reached, trade talks with many countries are still in flux.

title: Scientists Reconstruct Bust Of Woman From 10,500 Years Ago
content: Reborn via a close partnership between science and art, Mos'anne's bust was created at Belgium's Ghent University as part of a project to explore how the region's last hunter-gatherers lived during the Mesolithic era.

title: Ontario Cancels Internet Deal With Musk's Starlink Amid US Tariff Fight
content: The Canadian province of Ontario has cancelled $68.12 million satellite high-speed internet contract with Musk's company Starlink, following through with a vow by the province's premier to cut ties in retaliation for US tariffs imposed on Canada.

title: Bharat Rashtra Samithi Apprehensive Despite Supreme Court Deadline On MLA's Defections
content: The Supreme Court has given the Telangana Assembly Speaker three months to decide on whether 10 Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) MLAs, accused of joining the Congress, should be disqualified. However, this has not brought full relief to the BRS.

title: Trump's New Health Data Tracking System Raises Privacy Concerns
content: President Donald Trump has announced a plan for a new private health tracking system that will make it easier for patients to access their health records and monitor their wellness across health care systems and technologies.

title: Indian-Origin Man's Face Fractured In "Unprovoked Racist" Attack In Ireland
content: In what appears to be yet another racist attack in Ireland, an Indian-origin entrepreneur said he was brutally beaten by a group of teenagers in Dublin.

title: New York Gunman Bought Rifle From His Boss At Las Vegas Casino
content: A man who killed four people at a Manhattan office building bought the rifle he used in the attack, and the car he drove across country, from his supervisor at a Las Vegas casino, authorities said Wednesday.

title: 'Silent Killer': The Science Of Tracing Climate Deaths In Heatwaves
content: A heatwave scorching Europe had barely subsided in early July when scientists published estimates that 2,300 people may have died across a dozen major cities during the extreme, climate-fuelled episode.

title: Sacred Relics Of The Buddha Return To India After 127 Years
content: The sacred relics of the Buddha, originally excavated from Piprahwa in present-day Uttar Pradesh in 1898, were returned to India today after 127 years.

title: Elephant Falls Into Well In Coimbatore, Dies Despite Rescue Operation
content: The elephant reportedly entered farmlands near the foothills, prompting local farmers to alert forest officials. However, despite swift action deploying bulldozers, the elephant could not be saved.

title: "Case Ruined My Life": What Pragya Thakur Told Judge After Malegaon Verdict
content: Former BJP MP Pragya Thakur was today acquitted of all charges in the 2008 Malegaon blast case after a Mumbai court said there is no evidence to establish that the bike, allegedly used in the blast that claimed six lives, belonged to her.

title: US Lawmaker Set On Fire Outside Office By Man Carrying 20 Litres Of Petrol
content: A Virginia councilman was brutally attacked outside his office on Tuesday, after a man allegedly doused him in petrol and set him on fire in broad daylight. Lee Vogler was immediately moved to a burn care centre for future treatment.

title: "Operation Successful, Patient Dead": Supreme Court On BRS MLAs' Defection Case
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday directed the Speaker of the Telangana Legislative Assembly to decide on petitions seeking the disqualification of 10 MLAs, who jumped ship from the Bharat Rashtra Samiti (BRS) to the Congress in 2023.

title: "Anti-Terror Law UAPA Can't Be Invoked": What Court Said In Malegaon Verdict
content: All seven accused, including former BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur and former Army officer Lt Col Prasad Shrikant Purohit, have been acquitted by a special NIA court in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, in which six people died and over 100 were injured.

title: Live Updates: Pragya Thakur, Ex Army Officer Shrikant Purohit Acquitted In 2008 Malegaon Blast Case
content: After a 17-year-long wait, the Special National Investigation Agency (NIA) court in Mumbai announced its verdict today in the 2008 Malegaon blast case.

title: 'No proof that Pragya Thakur owned the bike': All Malegaon bomb blast accused acquitted
content: A special NIA court in Mumbai acquitted all seven accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, including Pragya Singh Thakur and Lt. Col. Shrikant Prasad Purohit, after a 17-year trial. The court cited a lack of concrete evidence, emphasizing that suspicion alone is insufficient for conviction.

title: 'Busy day' at WH: 25% tariff on India, 'dead economies' jibe, deal with Pak & more
content: President Trump unveiled a series of trade actions, imposing a 25% tariff and penalties on Indian goods due to trade imbalances and ties with Russia. Simultaneously, he offered to collaborate with Pakistan on oil development, hinting at potential future exports to India. Trump also announced trade measures against Brazil and South Korea, while criticizing Canada's stance on Palestinian statehood.

title: 'Stated a fact': Rahul Gandhi echoes Trump’s ‘dead economy’ remark on India
content: Rahul Gandhi, echoing Donald Trump's assessment, declared the Indian economy "dead," citing the Modi administration's policies. He blamed the Adani-Modi partnership, demonetization, flawed GST, and the failure of 'Assemble in India' for the economic decline. Trump criticized India's high tariffs and suggested India and Russia could face economic downturns together.

title: 'Bhagwa ki vijay hui hai': Pragya Thakur breaks down after acquittal
content: Pragya Singh Thakur, after being acquitted in the 2008 Malegaon blasts case, declared it a victory for 'Bhagwa,' alleging a conspiracy to defame it. The NIA court acquitted all seven accused, citing the prosecution's failure to prove the case beyond a reasonable doubt.

title: Salesforce CEO rejects predictions of widespread job displacement from AI
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff disputes predictions of AI-driven job losses, asserting that AI primarily enhances human capabilities, despite Salesforce's own automation initiatives. He highlights AI's accuracy limitations, emphasizing the ongoing necessity of human oversight for fact-checking and strategic decision-making. Benioff anticipates AI will fuel a surge in small business creation by democratizing access to enterprise-level tools.

title: IPL: KKR want KL Rahul in blockbuster trade; may make him captain
content: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) are reportedly interested in acquiring KL Rahul from Delhi Capitals for the 2026 IPL season, potentially offering him captaincy. Rahul's strong relationship with KKR's assistant coach Abhishek Nayar is a key factor. However, the trade might be difficult as KKR lacks suitable players to offer Delhi Capitals in return, after a disappointing 2025 season.

title: UP Sawan Mela scare: Biker crashes mid-stunt in ‘Maut ka Kuan’
content: Panic at the Sawan fair in Maharajganj when a motorcycle stunt went awry at the 'Well of Death,' causing the rider to fall. Surprisingly, the riderless motorcycle continued circling for nearly an hour, raising serious safety concerns. Authorities shut down the unauthorized attraction and launched an inquiry into safety violations at the rural fair.

title: Hilarious! Arshdeep, Jurel react to shirt worth Rs 3 Lakh in England market
content: Indian cricketers Arshdeep Singh and Dhruv Jurel explored Bicester Village in England. They were surprised by the high prices of designer clothes. Arshdeep Singh humorously reacted to a shirt costing Rs 3 lakh. Dhruv Jurel joked about a Rs 50,000 shirt. Kuldeep Yadav also made a brief appearance. The vlog captured their fun outing and camaraderie.

title: Mira Murati on her team rejecting Mark Zuckerberg’s $1 billion offer to join Meta AI
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: Trump tariffs: Why India’s stock market has not crashed - explained
content: The US imposed steep 25% tariffs on Indian imports, the highest in Asia, sparking market volatility. While initial concerns arose, analysts predict potential tariff reductions through negotiations, with a US trade delegation expected to visit India. Experts suggest a final deal with lower tariffs is likely, presenting buying opportunities in domestic-focused sectors.

title: Tragedy in Pakistan! German Olympic gold medallist dies in accident - details inside
content: German biathlon champion Laura Dahlmeier tragically died in a climbing accident on Laila Peak after being struck by falling rocks. Rescue efforts were hampered by weather, and her partner, Marina Eva, reached safety. Dahlmeier's family expressed gratitude for the rescue attempts, honoring her wish that no one risk their life for her recovery.

title: India-US trade deal: Will Trump tariffs make the American dream costlier for students?
content: Trump’s proposed 25% tariff on Indian exports could quietly raise the cost of studying in the US for Indian students. From pricier essentials and currency shocks to potential tuition hikes and fewer scholarships, the economic ripple may turn the American dream into a more expensive gamble. The fallout could reshape how Indian families plan for international education.

title: 'There are only engineers': Musk corrects 'hiring post' of xAI's Aditya Gupta
content: Elon Musk's xAI is doing away with the title "researcher," opting for "engineer" for all technical roles, a decision prompted by Musk's direct intervention on X. This move aims to eliminate what Musk sees as a two-tiered system, aligning xAI with companies like OpenAI and Anthropic that favor unified technical titles.

title: Trump’s 25% tariff to hit India’s exports! Which sectors are at maximum risk? Top 5 points to know
content: US President Trump has announced a 25% tariff on Indian exports, effective August 1, impacting sectors like electronics, pharmaceuticals, and jewellery. Trump criticized India's tariffs as "among the highest in the World" and hinted at penalties related to Russian energy purchases. This decision challenges India's trade expectations, potentially affecting 10% of its exports and disrupting key industries.

title: Chess has always been in Divya's genes; great-grandfather used to play with Vinoba Bhave
content: Divya Deshmukh, the youngest Indian woman to win the chess World Cup, has a family history with the game. Her great-grandfather, Dr. Durgaprasad Sharma, played chess with Vinoba Bhave. Divya's mother, Dr. Namrata Deshmukh, enrolled her in a chess academy at age five. Divya won her first national gold medal in 2012. Her parents supported her chess career, with Dr.

title: 'India-Russia can take their dead economies down together': Trump’s new jab after tariffs
content: Donald Trump declared a 25% tariff on Indian imports, stating he doesn't care about India's relationship with Russia, suggesting their economies could decline together. He criticized India's high tariffs and minimal US-Russia trade. Trump also mentioned a deal with Pakistan to develop oil reserves, potentially impacting exports to India.

title: IND vs ENG, 5th Test: Why no. 5 spot is now no. 1 worry for Gambhir's men?
content: Shubman Gill and the team management are contemplating the playing XI for Thursday's match, with Dhruv Jurel's batting skills under scrutiny. Rishabh Pant's absence necessitates a strategic reshuffle, potentially impacting the inclusion of Kuldeep Yadav or the persistence with Washington Sundar. Jasprit Bumrah's availability remains uncertain, while Arshdeep has been asked to be ready.

title: 'Kicked on chest, told to chant Jai Shri Ram': Malda woman recounts Delhi ‘torture’
content: A Malda woman residing in Delhi has alleged that Delhi police officers assaulted her, demanded she chant "Jai Shri Ram", confiscated her family's citizenship documents, and extorted Rs 25,000. She claims the police beat her and her son, and threatened her family.

title: Darul Uloom Deoband bans women’s entry again
content: Darul Uloom Deoband has reimposed a ban on women entering its campus due to repeated violations of social media guidelines. The seminary had conditionally lifted a previous ban last November, but visitors flouted rules by filming and posting videos online. Management sources cited distractions to students and disrespect towards the institution as reasons for the ban.

title: Watch: US navy F-35 jet crashes near Lemoore Air Station in California
content: A US Navy F-35 fighter jet crashed near Naval Air Station Lemoore in California on Wednesday evening. The pilot successfully ejected, and no immediate injuries were reported. The aircraft belonged to Strike Fighter Squadron VF-125, responsible for F-35 pilot training. The incident occurred around 6:30 pm, approximately 40 miles southwest of Fresno.

title: India vs England, 5th Test: Will rain play spoilsport at The Oval?
content: Shubman Gill's India faces England in the crucial 5th Test at The Oval, needing a win to level the series. The London weather forecast predicts rain throughout the match, potentially favoring swing bowlers. India seeks to maintain momentum from their Manchester comeback, while England, led by Ollie Pope, deals with injuries, adding intrigue to the contest.

title: Delta Air Lines mishap: 25 injured after severe turbulence; flight forced to land
content: A Delta Air Lines flight en route to Amsterdam from Salt Lake City made an emergency landing in Minneapolis after severe turbulence injured numerous passengers. Upon arrival, 25 individuals were hospitalized for evaluation and treatment. While Delta acknowledged the rarity and unpredictability of turbulence, authorities are investigating the incident.

title: Chidambaram's jibe at PM after Trump tariffs; asks what happened to MIGA + MAGA?
content: US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 25% tariff on Indian imports sparked criticism. Congress leaders like P Chidambaram questioned the effectiveness of 'Dosti' over diplomacy. Jairam Ramesh highlighted potential setbacks to India-US relations. The Centre responded by stating it is studying the implications and remains committed to protecting national interests.

title: $220m worth of deals under scanner: US sanctions 6 Indian firms over Iran oil trade
content: The US has imposed sanctions on six Indian businesses, along with other global entities, for allegedly violating restrictions on Iran by engaging in significant transactions involving Iranian petroleum and petrochemical products. These India-based companies are accused of importing and trading Iranian goods worth millions of dollars.

title: Tommy Brooks dies at 71: Legendary boxing trainer to Mike Tyson and Evander Holyfield
content: The boxing world mourns the loss of Tommy Brooks, the esteemed trainer who guided both Mike Tyson and Evander Holyfield to heavyweight glory. Brooks, who passed away at 71 after battling cancer, also trained Vitali Klitschko and other top contenders. A former fighter himself, Brooks' legacy extends beyond the ring as he mentored future generations of boxers and coaches.

title: Alerts, volcano and evacuation: Tsunami warnings lifted after earthquakes hit Russia
content: A powerful 8.8-magnitude earthquake struck near Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula, triggering a tsunami that spread across the Pacific. While the impact was minimal in Russia, Chile escalated its warning and initiated evacuations. The event, one of the strongest seismic events recorded, prompted tsunami alerts and advisories across the Pacific, with potential for coastal flooding and damage.

title: Study reveals shocking amount of plastic our homes and cars contain
content: Indoor air, especially in cars, contains surprisingly high levels of microplastics, with potential inhalation of tens of thousands of particles daily. These particles, often small enough to penetrate deep into lung tissue, originate from synthetic textiles, plastic packaging, and vehicle interiors. Exposure can lead to inflammation, oxidative stress, and other health concerns, prompting calls for mitigation strategies.

title: Church Street Chaos: German influencer Younes Zarou mobbed by fans in Bengaluru
content: German influencer Younes Zarou was briefly detained in Bengaluru after his social media post drew a massive crowd to Church Street, causing public safety concerns. Police intervened due to the lack of prior permission for the gathering, referencing a past stampede tragedy.

title: Techie killed over inter-caste love: Kavin's murder sparks outrage; family refuses to accept body
content: The murder investigation of Kavin Selvaganesh, a 27-year-old dalit man, has been transferred to CB-CID due to the main accused's parents being police sub-inspectors. Surjith has been detained under the Goondas Act. Kavin's parents are refusing to claim his body, demanding the arrest of Surjith's parents and action against allegedly complicit police officials.

title: Watch: Australia’s first home-made rocket crashes 14 seconds after lift-off
content: Australia's first attempt to launch a domestically built rocket into orbit ended in failure as the Eris vehicle crashed shortly after liftoff from Queensland. Despite the setback, Gilmour Space Technologies, the company behind the launch, hailed it as a milestone, noting the successful ignition of all four engines.

title: Kerala rapper Hirandas Vedan booked: Doctor alleges repeated sexual assault
content: Kerala-based rapper Hirandas Murali, known as Vedan, faces a sexual assault case after a doctor accused him of repeated sexual relations between August 2021 and March 2023 under the false pretense of marriage. Police have registered the case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code pertaining to sexual assault and deception.

title: UPSC IES and ISS 2025 result released: Direct link to download scorecards here
content: UPSC has declared the results of the IES and ISS Examinations 2025, held from June 20 to 22. Candidates who cleared the written stage will now proceed to the Personality Test. Their selection remains provisional until document verification. The result PDF is available at upsc.gov.in, with interview dates and DAF submission details to be announced soon.

title: Cricket: Gill on the verge of breaking Gavaskar, Bradman records in fifth IND vs ENG Test
content: Shubman Gill is on the verge of surpassing Don Bradman's 90-year-old record for most runs by a captain in a Test series, needing just 89 runs. As India face England in the decisive final Test at The Oval, Gill aims to etch his name in history.

title: Indian man rapes minor in Singapore: Ramalingam Selvasekaran molests 11-year-old
content: An Indian national, Ramalingam Selvasekaran, has been sentenced to over 14 years in a Singapore jail for sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl. The high court found him guilty of rape and outrage of modesty, following incidents at his Jurong West shop in 2021. Despite his denials and claims of erectile dysfunction, the judge deemed the victim's testimony credible.

title: Watch: Crazy scenes! Lionel Messi explodes at opponent
content: Lionel Messi's brilliance shone again as he delivered two crucial assists, including a last-gasp one, securing Inter Miami's thrilling 2-1 victory over Atlas in the Leagues Cup opener. His visible frustration after the winning goal sparked online buzz. The match was marked by tension, including a sideline argument between coaches.

title: China warns US against coercion on Russian oil tariffs
content: China has rebuffed US tariff threats over its Russian oil purchases, asserting its right to secure energy supplies and protect national interests. This firm stance follows US warnings during trade talks in Stockholm, where potential tariffs of up to 500% were discussed.

title: Donald Trump pays tribute to Hulk Hogan: Reflects on lifelong friendship and legacy
content: Donald Trump remembered Hulk Hogan, his friend. He spoke about their friendship and Hogan's support for him. Trump recalled Hogan's health issues from wrestling. He mentioned Hogan's speech at the Republican convention. Trump called Hogan a great showman and a friend of MAGA. Hogan endorsed Trump, calling him a hero. Hogan died at 71 due to cardiac arrest.

title: Malegaon blast: 17 years on, court to rule on terror case; ex-BJP MP Pragya Thakur among 7 accused
content: A special NIA court in Mumbai is set to pronounce judgment in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, which killed six and injured over 100. The accused, including Pragya Thakur and Lt Col Prasad Purohit, face charges under UAPA and IPC for their alleged involvement in the terror plot.

title: Chess: Divya dedicates World Cup title to her first trainer, who passed away in 2020
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh was celebrated at Nagpur airport after her Women's World Cup victory in Batumi, where she triumphed over Koneru Humpy. This win secured her the Grandmaster title, a spot in the Candidates tournament, and a $50,000 prize. She credited her first coach Rahul Joshi, who passed away in 2020.

title: IND vs ENG: Bumrah out, Kuldeep in! A new-look bowling attack to be fielded in 5th Test?
content: India, already trailing 1-2 in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2025, aim to draw the series against England in the final Test at The Oval. Wasim Jaffer suggests an XI featuring Kuldeep Yadav amid injuries to key players like Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah. The lineup emphasises a strong batting order and a three-man spin attack to salvage pride.

title: Railway police arrest two mules smuggling hashish oil to Bengaluru
content: The duo told the police that ‘they were offered money by Tangati Bharath to deliver the bag and return to their home town’

title: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla nominates Premachandran as empanelled member to preside over House proceedings
content: A leader of the Revolutionary Socialist Party (RSP), Mr. Premachandran represents Kerala's Kollam constituency.

title: India, Brazil hold key meet to boost defence ties, military cooperation
content: The eighth Joint Defence Committee meeting was held in Brasília on July 30, the Indian Defence Ministry said on July 31

title: Social media influencer Younes Zarou detained on Church Street in Bengaluru
content: Zarou, who has over 2.1 crore followers, had announced on his social media account — “church street we are coming “ — leading to a huge turnout of people

title: Trump tariffs on India: analysing the economic and strategic impact
content: Top experts examine how the Trump tariffs will impact Indian exports, India–U.S. trade negotiations, BRICS dynamics, and New Delhi’s global economic strategy

title: Kerala Education Minister proposes discussion on changing annual school vacation timings amid climate concerns
content: Raising the prospect of switching April-May summer vacation to June-July, Sivankutty says education experts have repeatedly flagged worrying loss of study days caused during school reopening phase in June, when monsoon besets Kerala

title: 'Lie, distortion': Congress leader Chidambaram slams Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks on delay in Afzal Guru's execution
content: P. Chidambaram's remarks came in response to Amit Shah's statement in the Rajya Sabha that the death sentence for Afzal Guru could not be carried out for as long as Mr. Chidambaram was the Home Minister

title: Former HC judge P. N. Desai submits probe report on alleged MUDA scam in Karnataka
content: The State Government had constituted a one-man judicial commission, headed by Mr. Desai, to probe allegations of the involvement of Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his wife Parvati

title: Raichur MP G. Kumar Naik alleges stagnation in Institutions of Eminence scheme of Union Government
content: Mr. Naik pointed out that while 12 universities have been granted the ‘eminence’ tag, no new Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) has been signed since 2022

title: Govt to focus on establishing Karnataka as a global exporter of quantum solutions: CM Siddaramaiah
content: Quantum India Bengaluru is being jointly organised by the Department of Science and Technology and IISc Quantum Technology Initiative.

title: Hindus, indigenous faith believers may share crematoria, Meghalaya High Court is told
content: The court said an acute dearth of space necessitates common burial grounds for members of all denominations of Christians in the State

title: Premallatha Vijayakant meets T.N. CM Stalin, enquires about his health
content: The visit by Ms. Vijayakant, though presented as a courtesy call, has added a new layer to the political optics in Tamil Nadu, fuelling speculation amid evolving developments in a State that will go to Assembly polls in less than a year

title: Kerala Minister Sivankutty accuses BJP leader K. Surendran of disparaging SC/ST communities, demands prosecution
content: Sivankutty takes exception to Surendran’s alleged imputation that the ruling front and Opposition MPs and MLAs elected from reserved constituencies in Kerala were SC/ST members ‘only in name’

title: Kerala cyber police file case over morphed images of woman actor shared through fake social media profile
content: The actor has complained that the morphed pictures have been shared in a Facebook group with about 15,000 members

title: ED conducts first-ever search operation in Andaman & Nicobar Islands
content: The agency has seized documents purportedly indicating large-scale irregularities in the grant of loans and overdraft facilities by Andaman Nicobar State Cooperative Bank

title: Police deploy 900 officials, six drones, 40 CCTV cameras for Jagan Mohan Reddy’s visit to Nellore
content: Special teams have been appointed for traffic control, security measures and maintenance of peace and security and continuous surveillance

title: PMK has only one leader and one headquarters: Ramadoss
content: “Their (padayatra) exercise would only be futile,” he said, in a reference to his estranged son Anbumani Ramadoss, who has undertaken a 100-day march across Tamil Nadu

title: Odisha govt to distribute third instalment of Subhadra scheme on August 9
content: The scheme is designed to provide eligible women aged between 21 and 60 years with ₹50,000 over five years, from 2024-25 to 2028-29

title: Jana Sena Party will ensure bright political future for dedicated leaders, activists: Party general secretary Nagababu
content: K. Nagababu toured extensively in Vizianagaram and Srikakulam district and held in-camera meetings with senior leaders and public representatives of the party in the last three days

title: Layoffs: Karnataka Labour Department sends notice to TCS, calls for meeting
content: Karnataka State IT/ITeS Employees Union claims receiving more than 25 calls on its helpline from employees being forced to resign

title: 2008 Malegaon blast case: Special NIA court acquits all seven accused, including Pragya Thakur, Lt. Col. Purohit
content: Pragya Thakur, turned into a sanyasi, gave up all the material things in life before the incident happened, the court observed while acquitting her and six others accused in the blast case.

title: AMMA election: Actor Jagadeesh opts out of race for post of president in Malayalam film body
content: Jagadeesh reportedly decided to withdraw from the fray amid support from various quarters for a woman president in AMMA. Swetha Menon is the lone woman candidate

title: Piprahwa gems: Sacred Buddha relics, originally set for auction in Hong Kong in May, returns to India
content: "This momentous repatriation has been made possible through an exemplary public-private partnership between the government of India and the Godrej Industries Group," the Ministry of Culture said

title: China challenge, India’s bid for strategic autonomy behind Trump’s harsh tariff terms: Ram Madhav
content: Ram Madhav said the tariff announcement and the subsequent rough statements over India by Mr Trump have as much to do with China as with India itself

title: SC directs Telangana Speaker to decide on disqualification petitions against 10 MLAs within three months
content: The apex court urged the Parliament to review the disqualification proceedings under the Tenth Schedule of the Constitution, saying Assembly Speakers tend to delay the process due to latent political considerations

title: A.P. gets Railway Zone in Vizag,  Telangana gains Railway Coach Factory under Reorganization Act
content: In response to a Right to Information (RTI) query raised by this The Hindu Correspondent, the Ministry of Railways has explained that as part of executing the A.P. Reorganization Act, the department has undertaken these infrastructure development works.

title: After ‘Dog Babu’, now ‘Dogesh Babu’ submits form for residential certificate in Bihar
content: The application was immediately cancelled and disciplinary action was taken against guilty officials and employees into this. The ruling JD(U) smacked “conspiracy” by opposition Rashtriya Janata Dal to defame the government into this

title: Andhra Pradesh floods LIVE: Dams in the State almost full
content: According to Andhra Pradesh State Disaster Management Authority (APSDMA) three lakh cusecs of floodwater inflows are expected to reach Prakasam Barrage in Vijayawada

title: India, Russia can take their ‘dead economies’ down together: Trump
content: “We have done very little business with India, their tariffs are too high, among the highest in the world,” Donald Trump said on Truth Social

title: Woman caught with ₹14 crore worth drugs at RGI Airport
content: A preliminary investigation reveals that she was waiting for associates in Hyderabad, who were expected to collect the consignment and transport it to Mumbai

title: Bengal colleges face a new challenge: to make up for exceptional delay in admission process this year
content: The delay, which had no official explanation, is largely attributed to West Bengal’s new OBC list being caught in a legal tangle

title: U.S. sanctions Indian nationals and firms in global crackdown on Iran’s oil network
content: The action, announced by the Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), is part of the largest Iran-related sanctions package since 2018

title: Kavi Subhas, a major Kolkata metro station to remain closed for nearly a year after cracks appear on structure
content: Regular commuters worried about daily commute as Kavi Subhas metro which connects the city with the local passenger train shuts down indefinitely

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Mariners agree to deal for Suarez
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: Sources: Mariners finalizing deal for 3B Suarez
content: The Mariners are finalizing a deal for slugging third baseman Eugenio Suárez, with Seattle set to send three prospects to Arizona in return, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan.

title: Lynx defeat Liberty in anticipated Finals rematch
content: The Lynx defeated the Liberty 100-93 on Wednesday night in long-anticipated rematch of last year's WNBA Finals teams.

title: Ohtani exits start due to cramps, blames weather
content: Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani said he pitched through cramping in his right hip and had to cut his start short in the fourth inning of Wednesday night's 5-2 loss to the Reds.

title: Phillies get their closer by landing Twins' Duran
content: The Phillies acquired star closer Jhoan Duran from the Twins, who get right-hander Mick Abel and catcher Eduardo Tait, both prospects, in return.

title: Raiders agree to 3-year extension with LT Miller
content: The Las Vegas Raiders reached a contract extension with starting left tackle Kolton Miller on Wednesday, with sources telling ESPN's Jeremy Fowler that the deal is for three years and $66 million, with $42.5M guaranteed.

title: Police: Vegas casino supervisor sold gunman rifle
content: A man who killed four people at a Manhattan office building bought the rifle he used in the attack and the car he drove across the country from his supervisor at a Las Vegas casino, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Arenas arrested on illegal poker game charges
content: Gilbert Arenas was arrested in connection with a federal indictment that alleges the former NBA star hosted illegal high-stakes poker games at his mansion.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: Mets keep fortifying bullpen, get Cards' Helsley
content: The Mets traded three players to the Cardinals for closer Ryan Helsley, who was expected to serve as the setup man in New York for Edwin Diaz.

title: Red Sox add to staff, acquire Matz from Cards
content: The Red Sox struck a deal with the Cardinals for veteran left-hander Steven Matz, with Boston sending minor league first baseman Blaze Jordan to St. Louis in return.

title: Source: O's send utility infielder Urias to Astros
content: The Astros acquired utility infielder Ramon Urias from the Orioles in exchange for minor league pitcher Twine Palmer, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Cubs add righty Soroka, send 2 prospects to Nats
content: The Chicago Cubs acquired pitcher Mike Soroka from the Washington Nationals for two prospects on Wednesday night.

title: M's get Ferguson from Pirates to bolster bullpen
content: The Mariners, in search of bullpen help, finalized a deal to acquire lefty reliever Caleb Ferguson from the Pirates in exchange for minor leaguer Jeter Martinez.

title: After twin dealt, Rogers goes from Giants to Mets
content: Hours after his identical twin brother, Taylor, was traded from the Reds to the Pirates, Tyler Rogers was traded from the Giants to the Mets for three players.

title: Reds acquire Gold Glove 3B Hayes from Pirates
content: The Reds have acquired third baseman Ke'Bryan Hayes from the Pirates in exchange for reliever Taylor Rogers and prospect Sammy Stafura.

title: With Judge out, Yankees trade for OF Slater
content: The Yankees have acquired outfielder Austin Slater from the White Sox, as New York continues to bolster a roster currently without superstar outfielder Aaron Judge.

title: How Chris Bey's life changed after one routine move went catastrophically wrong
content: After a life-changing spinal cord injury, Chris Bey wasn't expected to walk again. Nine months later, he's not only walking, he is eyeing a return to professional wrestling.

title: Ranking every prospect dealt before the MLB trade deadline: There's a new No. 1 -- again!
content: You know the major leaguers on the move -- but what about the potential stars of tomorrow headed the other way in those deals?

title: Wetzel: Next NFLPA boss should understand the job
content: NFLPA adventure with Howell shows the union has lost focus in finding leaders driven to represent labor.

title: USWNT newcomers ranked: All 24 players who have debuted under coach Emma Hayes
content: The USWNT roster has undergone sweeping change under coach Emma Hayes. Let's rank the new players by how likely it is they'll represent the U.S. at the next World Cup.

title: 11 teams ready to build on last season ... or put it behind them
content: FSU has nowhere to go but up, Michigan can get better and Arizona State is building on its CFP berth.

title: It's time for The Ocho! Check out the 2025 schedule, plus how to watch every event
content: It's time for the 2025 edition of The Ocho! Check out how to watch T-Rex races, paintball, dog surfing and more alternative events on ESPN now.

title: How Ichiro's HOF induction helps tell the story of Japanese baseball
content: On Ichiro Suzuki's induction weekend, a new exhibit in Cooperstown shares his place in the international baseball landscape.

title: Panic or patience? What to do with Aaron Judge on the IL
content: With Aaron Judge spending time on the IL, what should fantasy managers do without the best hitter in the league?

title: Six late-round 'fliers' who can help you win your league
content: Hitting on a player late in drafts can be a big boost -- to your team and your ego. Here are six "fliers" you need to be considering.

title: Clay's Playbook: A game plan for your draft day
content: Mike Clay goes position by position and lays out a successful approach for 2025 fantasy football drafts.

title: August urgency will soon end the lull in soccer's summer transfer window
content: The final days of July are the dog days of soccer's summer transfer window, but August will bring a flurry of wheeling and dealing.

title: Gyökeres unfazed by Arsenal pressure, Henry's No. 14
content: Viktor Gyökeres was signed to make Arsenal champions, so taking an icon's shirt was always going to be noticed.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool reach verbal agreement with Isak
content: Liverpool have taken another step closer to signing Newcastle United's Alexander Isak. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Rapper Vedan booked for rape after complaint of sexual abuse on promise of marriage
content: Police say the incidents leading to the complaint took place a few years ago. Case was registered by Thrikkakara police after it was mentioned as one of the places where the alleged sexual abuse on the promise of marriage took place

title: India has to contend with political challenges from ‘China, America, Pakistan’ now, says Congress
content: On July 30, Mr. Trump also announced that the U.S. will help Pakistan explore and develop its oil and gas reserves, Mr. Ramesh said, adding that this comes on top of his full-throated support to Pakistan receiving financial assistance from the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund.

title: National Sports Governance Bill: Centralisation of Indian sports with more transparency and timely elections
content: All sports bodies in India, including the BCCI, will have to seek recognition from a National Sports Board

title: Leopard spotted on Hyderabad outskirts 20 days ago; captured by foresters
content: The animal, a healthy adult male, walked into the cage during night, lured by the live bait, officials informed.

title: Wild cat, wilder rumours: Leopard out of sight, but social media keeps panic alive
content: Fictional narratives about the animal, which was first spotted around Chilukur, are doing rounds at a frenzied pace, confounding the residents around Gandipet and leading to fear-mongering.

title: Indian national gets 14 years in jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Singapore
content: Sentenced by the Singapore High Court, Ramalingam Selvasekaran, 58, will not be caned, as he is over 50. However, his sentence of 14 years, three months and two weeks includes additional jail time in lieu of 15 strokes of the cane

title: U.P. SDM transferred day after doing sit-ups in front of lawyers to admit filth in tehsil premises
content: Shahjahanpur District Magistrate Dharmendra Pratap Singh told PTI that Rahi, who was posted to Puwaiyan tehsil only on Tuesday, has now been relieved of the post.

title: Sudden braking on Highway is negligence, says Supreme Court
content: A bench comprising Justices Suddhanshu Dhulia and Aravind Kumar observed that a driver's abrupt halt in the middle of a highway, even if triggered by a personal emergency, cannot be justified if it endangers other road users.

title: Same-day darshan for ‘Srivani’ ticket-holders in Tirumala
content: TTD to roll out the pilot initiative from August 1; from November 1, both offline and online ticket-holders will be granted darshan at 4.30 p.m. through the Vaikuntham Queue Complex-1, says official

title: MBBS student in Kashmir posts video of ‘career’s first delivery case’ online, faces flak from J&K medical council
content: A doctor from the Government Medical College, Srinagar, posted a video online as part of his vlogging to “celebrate” the patient’s delivery inside the theatre

title: Vijayawada reinstated Haj embarkation point
content: The announcement follows a formal request by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to Union Minister of Minority Affairs Kiren Rijiju

title: High alert sounded along the Krishna amid huge inflows from Pulichintala
content: In Vijayawada, the authorities lifted all the 70 crest gates at the Prakasam Barrage, releasing 71,000 cusecs of water downstream

title: Liquor scam case: SIT takes into custody, questions Varun Purushotham
content: Named Accused No. 40 in the case, Varun, who has been on the run and against whom the court issued NBW, has been taken into custody at the Shamshabad airport as he arrives from Dubai; Accused No. 1 Kessireddy files affidavit in court stating he has no connection with the ₹11 crore cash seized in a farmhouse in Ranga Reddy district

title: Malda migrant worker’s family backs Mamata claim of harassment by Delhi police
content: Sanjur Parveen and other members of the family who hail from Malda in West Bengal held a press conference at the Trinamool Congress party office in Kolkata and alleged torture by Delhi police. The Delhi police said that the video shared by the Chief Minister about migrant worker’s family alleging harassment in the national capital was fabricated.

title: Plus One: admission to vacant seats on July 31
content: Students who had applied for admission in the merit quota but had not got allotment had been given time till 4 p.m. on Wednesday to apply for admission to seats that still remained vacant

title: President Murmu lauds contributions of former West Bengal Chief Minister Dr B.C. Roy
content: The President on Wednesday attended the first convocation ceremony of AIIMS, Kalyani in West Bengal’s Nadia district

title: ‘Over 42,000 fake birth certificates of illegal Bangladeshis cancelled in Maharashtra till now, but many more exist’
content: In a special drive till August 15, the State govt to cancel all ‘fake’ birth certificates to Bangladeshis staying illegally in the State, says minister

title: On SC directive, CBI registers 22 cases to probe alleged builders-banks nexus; conducts searches at 47 locations in NCR
content: Hundreds of homebuyers in the NCR, being cheated by builders/developers and further aggrieved by the coercive action of financial institutions against them, had approached the Supreme Court seeking relief

title: RSS arm seeks clarity on draft guidelines on biosimilars
content: Swadeshi Jagran Manch appreciated the draft guidelines for embracing the “3Rs principle” (replacement, reduction, refinement) as it reflects India’s commitment to ethical scientific practices

title: No expenditure incurred on engaging social media influencers, says Centre
content: Eight influencer marketing agencies were empanelled for the MyGov citizen engagement platform following the due process, Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L. Murugan said

title: At least two soldiers, two teachers killed in shooting stone, flash floods in Ladakh, J&K
content: An Army spokesperson said two soldiers died when an Army vehicle was hit by a boulder during a convoy movement between Durbuk to Chongtash

title: Odisha evacuates 5,000 people as floods upend lives of 30,000
content: While 5,000 people have been evacuated, the Odisha government has announced that cooked food will be supplied for the next seven days to the affected

title: CRPF constable found dead in Bijapur
content: An investigation was underway to ascertain the exact reason that prompted him to take the extreme step

title: Small-scale fishers seek rollback of unified licence fee
content: They allege that the unified fee, which treats small and big boats alike, has doubled the financial burden of traditional operators

title: Contract for biomining of legacy waste at Brahmapuram extended till September
content: Opposing the extension of the contract, the UDF says the volume of waste at Brahmapuram is exaggerated; cites audit objections and failure of the company to complete biomining within the agreed time

title: World Day Against Trafficking: Telangana pushes for time-bound justice for trafficked children
content: Between April 2024 and April 2025, the JRC network of 250 NGOs in 418 districts rescued 56,242 trafficked children and initiated over 38,000 legal actions across India

title: Promoting A.P. as investment destination remains mainstay of Naidu’s Singapore tour
content: Singapore Minister says his government will continue to support the development of Andhra Pradesh and Amaravati, through technical cooperation

title: 2,900 people rescued as heavy rains create flood-like situation in M.P.; two die as house collapses in Gwalior
content: The Chief Minister has also directed all district administrations and concerned authorities to remain on high alert due to the forecast of heavy rains over the next two days in several districts

title: Apollo launches ‘End-O Check’ for early detection of ovarian cancer
content: End-O Check provides comprehensive risk assessment, clinical diagnostics, and symptom monitoring to support early detection of gynaecologic cancers, particularly in postmenopausal women

title: Remove laws going against leprosy-hit persons: Supreme Court
content: The court said the Centre and States will do great service by removing discriminatory provisions of law. It urged States to call a one-day Assembly session or enact an ordinance

title: Inclusion of TRF in report under 1267 Committee a boost for India’s counter-terror campaign: officials
content: India has described the TRF as a front of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and accused it of carrying out the Pahalgam terror attack; in its report, the Monitoring Team of the panel noted that the TRF had taken responsibility for the attack

title: Andhra Pradesh to focus on expanding tourism infrastructure
content: Promoting key cities like Visakhapatnam, Vijayawada, and Tirupati as preferred MICE destinations, unlocking the potential of tier-2 and tier-3 locations and advancing PPP models to drive sustainable and inclusive regional growth are priorities, says APTDC Managing Director

title: BJP MP raises demand in Lok Sabha for Bharat Ratna to Dalai Lama
content: “Today, the Dalai Lama is not just a religious figure but also a symbol of peace across the world. His teachings have shaped generations and he deserves the Bharat Ratna,” BJP MP Tapir Gao said

title: Opposition targets India’s diplomacy over Trump’s tariff announcement, seeks explanation from PM
content: ‘Trump is targeting India politically, economically, and morally. And the Prime Minister is not being truthful, neither to the people nor to Parliament,’ CPI general secretary D. Raja said
